item.title: New World: Aeternum To Be Taken Offline Next Year
item.content:encoded:
The time of New World: Aeternum is coming to an end.

After it was announced that no new content was coming to the game and that it would be taken offline after 2026, Amazon Games has given an update as to when New World: Aeternum will go dark.

When Will New World Come Down?

In a blog post on Thursday, Amazon Games announced that New World: Aeternum will be taken offline on January 31, 2027. From that point on, no one will be able to continue playing the game.

With this announcement also comes the news that as of today, January 15, the game will be delisted and no longer available for purchase. If you already own the game, you can still play it and reinstall it as much as you want until the January 31, 2027 date arrives.

‚ÄúWe want to thank the players for your dedication and passion,‚Äù they said. ‚ÄúWe are grateful for the time spent crafting the world of Aeternum with you. Together we built something special. While we are saddened to say goodbye, we‚Äôre honored that we were able to share so much with the community.‚Äù

The end of New World comes after its development team was hit with layoffs back in October. At the time, the layoffs spanned across all of Amazon, including its game studios and Twitch.

It has been our pleasure to work on New World: Aeternum and evolve this unforgettable adventure with you all. We look forward to one more year together and giving this fantastic adventure a sendoff worthy of a legendary hero. From the bottom of all our hearts, thank you for sharing this world with us.

Are you going to jump back into New World: Aeternum before it goes offline? Leave your thoughts on the game‚Äôs legacy down in the comments, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Insider Gaming, read the exclusive details surrounding WWE 2K26‚Äôs Showcase Mode and its feature star CM Punk. And don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of‚Ä¶

More from Mike Straw

item.title: Subway Surfers Is Getting a Sequel Next Month
item.content:encoded:
The sequel to Subway Surfers, Subway Surfer City, releases on February 26, 2026; interested players can pre-register now.

Subway Surfers is undoubtedly not only one of the most popular endless runners out there, but also one of the most-played mobile games. I know I have spent hours on end trying achieve the highest score and beat all my friends. Fans of this game can now look forward to a brand new sequel, which introduces a lot of new stuff.

Subway Surfers City Release Date Revealed

Revealed through a new post on X (formerly Twitter), Subway Surfers City arrives next month with new gameplay mechanics, game modes, challenges, and improved visuals. A new press release on Business Wire by the developer SYBO reveals some of the new mechanics players will be able to try out.

The game will introduce a ‚Äústomp move‚Äù that can be used to reveal hidden advantages, a ‚Äúbouncy bubblegum shield‚Äù that can enhance your jump abilities, and more.

Additionally, there are three new modes to look forward to once Subway Surfers City is released. Classic Endless, the endless runner experience where players chase new high scores. The City Tour, which is a finite game mode where players will progress through levels, complete goals and explore districts while completing missions and finding hidden stars. Lastly, there is the Events mode, which will feature a rotation of finite runs and trials.

The original Subway Surfers game crossed 4.5 billion lifetime downloads in 2025, making it the most downloaded mobile game of all time, so the sequel has some pretty big shoes to fill.

Interested readers can pre-register for Subway Surfers City prior to its release on the Google Play Store and iOS App Store.

In other news, a new Life is Strange game is scheduled to be revealed next week. Additionally, PlayStation recently delisted over 1,000 shovelware games from its store. Will you be playing Subway Surfers City once it releases next month? Leave your thoughts on all this and more down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more tech news from Insider Gaming, check out the exclusive report on CM Punk headlining WWE 2K26‚Äôs Showcase Mode. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
